pages.text: Allonnia comes from the middle Cambrian, with fossils found across the globe. It is a small chancelloriid, growing up to 5 cm in height. It differs from the namesake of the family, Chancelloria, by the fact that it has a more globular shape and how the spines form, consisting of only three rays.
